ticket.title: Bug in before_validation "[FATAL] failed to allocate memory"
ticket.original-body:
If my model has a before_validation and i call the method "valid?", it returns "[FATAL] failed to allocate memory". I tested using Ruby 1.8.7 and Ruby 1.9.2
Rails version 3.0.0.rc
Using Ruby 1.9.2
ruby-1.9.2-p0 > a = Project.new(:name => "a") => #<Project id: nil, name: "a", path: nil, url: nil, created_at: nil, updated_at: nil> ruby-1.9.2-p0 > a.valid? SystemStackError: stack level too deep from /home/lucas/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.2-p0/lib/ruby/1.9.1/irb/workspace.rb:80 Maybe IRB bug!! ruby-1.9.2-p0 >
Using Ruby 1.8.7
ruby-1.8.7-p299 > a = Project.new(:name => "a") => #<Project id: nil, name: "a", path: nil, url: nil, created_at: nil, updated_at: nil> ruby-1.8.7-p299 > a.valid? [FATAL] failed to allocate memory
